headline: Apple Stock Hasn’t Had a Streak Like This Since 2010. What It Means as Value Nears $4 Trillion.
summary: Apple  is on the cusp of an artificial-intelligence-fueled “golden era of growth,” Wedbush analysts argued Thursday as they raised their price target on shares of the tech giant.  Wedbush analyst Dan Ives increased his price target to $325, a Wall Street high, and maintained an Outperform rating, just days after reiterating a $300 price target on the stock.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet have an average price target of $248.14 on Apple shares.

headline: Apple's price target bumped to $325 by Wedbush
summary: Wedbush Securities is growing increasingly bullish on Apple (AAPL), with analyst Dan Ives raising the company's price target from $300 to $325. The upgrade comes as Apple approaches a $4 trillion market capitalization, and Ives cites the upcoming iPhone 16 cycle as the catalyst for what he calls a "new golden era" for the tech giant. Catalysts anchors Brad Smith and Brian Sozzi break down the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Wedbush lifts Apple price target by $25 banking on AI-driven growth
summary: Investing.com -- Wedbush raised its price target on Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) to $325 from $300 banking on transformative AI-driven iPhone upgrade cycle poised to fuel growth into 2025. The brokerage maintained its "outperform" rating, projecting Apple’s market cap to cross the $4 trillion mark.

headline: Prediction: 2 AI Stocks Will Be Worth More Than Apple Stock by Year-End in 2025
summary: Apple is currently the most valuable publicly traded company in the world, with a market value of $3.9 trillion.  The company has held that title for the better part of a decade but has yet to demonstrate it can monetize artificial intelligence (AI).  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) is currently worth $3.4 trillion.
